column1:
3.11.5.5	
Summary of evidence and recommendations for the disease management of bacterial prostatitis

Treat acute bacterial prostatitis according to the recommendations for complicated UTIs 
Strong
(see section 3.7.5).

Prescribe a fluoroquinolone (e.g. ciprofloxacin, levofloxacin) as first-line treatment for CBP.
Strong

Prescribe a macrolide (e.g. azithromycin) or a tetracycline (e.g. doxycycline) if intracellular 
Strong
bacteria have been identified as the causative agent of CBP.

Prescribe metronidazole in patients with Trichomonas vaginalis CBP.
Strong
